name: airpods-tools
title: AirPods Tools
description: A set of tools for controlling your AirPods listening modes and displaying battery information from Raycast. Switch between Noise Cancellation, Adaptive, or Transparency using Siri, or check the battery levels of your AirPods.
author: raulg

commands.name: set-noise-cancellation
commands.title: Set Noise Cancellation
commands.subtitle: AirPods
commands.description: Set the AirPods to Noise Cancellation (ANC) listening mode.

commands.name: set-transparency
commands.title: Set Transparency
commands.subtitle: AirPods
commands.description: Set the AirPods to Transparency listening mode.

commands.name: set-adaptive
commands.title: Set Adaptive
commands.subtitle: AirPods
commands.description: Set the AirPods to Adaptive listening mode. ⚠️ Only works if your AirPods support Adaptive mode (AirPods Pro 2nd gen or later).

commands.name: switch-mode
commands.title: Switch Listening Mode
commands.subtitle: AirPods
commands.description: This command will cycle the AirPods your two preferred listening modes. The modes states are managed locally by this extension, so if you change listening modes using any other method this command won't be able to read the current mode and may try to set the mode that is currently active in your AirPods.

commands.name: battery-status
commands.title: Battery Status
commands.subtitle: AirPods
commands.description: Display the battery levels of your AirPods.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
